etymology.description: 匸(匸) (xì, "enclosure") + 品(品) (pǐn, "many people") = many people inside an enclosure -> district
etymology.interpretation: The character represents the idea of a space that contains many people, suggesting a defined area or district.
etymology.simplification: 區(區) simplified to 区(區) by replacing 品(品) (pǐn, "many people") with 乂(乂) (yì, "to govern"), which is visually simpler.

examples.chinese: 这个区风景秀丽(這個區風景秀麗)。
他们参观了老区展览(他們參觀了老區展覽)，了解了丰富的历史(了解了豐富的歷史)。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen cānguānle lǎo qū zhǎnlǎn, liǎojiěle fēngfù de lìshǐ.
examples.english: They visited the exhibition in the old district and learned about its rich history.

examples.chinese: 新区规划合理(新區規劃合理)，未来发展可期(未來發展可期)。
examples.pinyin: Xīn qū guīhuà hélǐ, wèilái fāzhǎn kě qī.
examples.english: The new district is well planned, and its future development is promising.
